column4: can anyone help me with ssh? i can ping the target machine but I cannot connect or telnet, it times out\
ssh and telnet are different... are you trying to ssh, or to telnet?
i tried telnet because someone who was helping me earlier asked me to try it and then left
if ssh server is installed, and you're trying to connect to the correct port - then check the firewall setting on the server
22 is set to forward on his firewall, through a router, we are in different states
ah i see. so, what happens when you try "ssh <his ip> 22" or "telnet <his ip> 22" ?
just times out, no rejection messages, no nothing?
just sits there right then times out
can he connect to his own machine? has he tried - just to make sure it works?
i believe it might be his only linux computer
he should try both a "ssh localhost", and a "ssh <his lan ip>" and a "ssh <his wan ip>" and see if any of that works
he doesn't need another computer to try :)
ok im going to have him do that, btw what does it mean if i do that to myself and 22 is refused
technically i'm the client so im assuming thats why
well, if you do an "ssh localhost" yourself, and it's refused, it's because you are not running an ssh server on your machine.
he's the one that should be doing it, to test whether his ssh server is operational
the authenticity of the localhost could not be established

test in steps: ssh localhost tests whether server is up at all. ssh <lan ip> tests if the server is listening on his net interface as it should. ssh <wan ip> tests whether the router is forwarding things along properly. that way you can isolate the problem
is that what he says he gets when he tries ssh localhost?
yep
the thing about authenticity, and maybe about accepting a new key?
run "gnome-panel" from the terminal?
says a panel is already running. when you kill it, it instantly respons the proc but i can't see the panel anywhere
